My Tx 19.99999999 Gwei
Other Bot Tx 20 Gwei <- can execute the arbitrage opportunity
Trade (creates arbitrage opportunity) - 20 Gwei
Other Bot Tx 20 Gwei

author: hendrik_h
content:
Their intention is not to knock all other txs off of the pool.
The intention is that you want to be the next tx after a particular tx that I will call "victim".

Victim swaps 50 ETH -> DAI on UniswapV1 at gas price 20 Gwei creating an arbitrage opportunity.
Bot wants to arbitrage UniswapV1 and UniswapV2.

There are many bots that monitor the mempool and want to execute that trade.
If I send an arbitrage tx with +1Wei, I won't be able to execute it because my tx will be executed *before* the Victim.
I could send a tx with -1 Wei to be executed right after the victim which allows me to execute the trade in the same block.

However the new strategy is to send n txs at 20 Gwei hoping that one of these will be sorted right after the Victim.
Since on the majority of geth nodes txs within one gas cohort are sorted randomly (due to the map implementation) it becomes a numbers game.

If I send 9 txs at 20 gwei and the Victim is the only other tx at 20, my chances to be placed after the Victim are 9/10. 
Others will start bidding with txs as well until `tx_cost == chance * potential_profit * margin_factor`.

Since you can't spam the txs from the same address (since txs from one address are sorted right after each other by nonce) you can checkout bloxy to see how many individual callers each of these contracts have.
Max Callers = max numbers of txs spammed on one opportunity (usually between 100-600)
